channel.title: Qubes versus Whonix [Solved]
channel.description: I see in the documentation the reference to Whonix and Whonix/Qubes. I had understood them to be competitors. What is the difference and what is the relationship?

item.title: Qubes versus Whonix [Solved]
item.dc:creator: randy
item.description:
Thank you for that clarification.

Read full topic

item.title: Qubes versus Whonix [Solved]
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Qubes is an operating system primarily running on hardware, based on Xen, security by compartmentalization, with templates for VMs available for Fedora, Debian, and Qubes-Whonix.

Whonix is an operating system primarily running inside VMs. Supported platforms include VirtualBox, KVM and Qubes.

Qubes and Whonix do cooperate. Whonix is easy available and well supported in Qubes, called Qubes-Whonix.

Read full topic
